supply_logistics.supply_status: Adequate for defensive operations. Division newly arrived in North Africa (August 1942), last major German reinforcement to reach theater. Initial supply state better than veteran divisions but still constrained by long Mediterranean supply lines. Primary supply base at Benghazi (700km west) and Tobruk. Water supply critical for newly acclimatized troops in desert conditions.

weather_environment.terrain_type: Coastal plain and rocky desert - El Alamein defensive sector

subordinate_units.note: Estimated from generic light division establishment
Estimated from generic light division establishment
Estimated from generic light division establishment
Estimated from generic light division establishment

tactical_doctrine.role: Light infantry division for defensive operations in El Alamein sector. Newly arrived division assigned to holding defensive positions. Limited motorization compared to 90. leichte Division. Designed for positional defense rather than mobile desert operations.
special_capabilities: Recently reinforced division with fresh troops
Full strength infantry regiments (three regiments vs. four for 90. leichte)
Standard German defensive doctrine and training
tactical_innovations: Integration into established Afrika Korps defensive systems
known_issues: Limited desert warfare experience (newly arrived August 1942)
Less motorization than 90. leichte Division (documented as 'limited motorization')
Troops not yet acclimatized to extreme desert conditions
Insufficient anti-aircraft protection against British air superiority
Last major German reinforcement to reach North Africa - no follow-on support expected
tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: Division undergoing rapid acclimatization to desert conditions. Water discipline, heat management, and desert navigation being learned from veteran units. Limited time for adaptation before First Battle of El Alamein (July 1-27, 1942).

scenario_suitability: First Battle of El Alamein (July 1-27, 1942) - Defensive operations
Second Battle of El Alamein (October 23 - November 11, 1942) - Division participated in defense
Static defensive scenarios in desert terrain
Introduction to desert warfare scenarios (green troops in harsh environment)
special_rules: Fresh Reinforcement: Better supply state initially (+1 supply), but -1 to desert operations (acclimatization)
Limited Motorization: Reduced movement compared to 90. leichte Division
Positional Defense: +1 to prepared defensive positions
No Tank Support: Cannot operate independently against enemy armor without attached units
Desert Novices: -1 to sustained desert operations beyond 2 days (acclimatization penalty)
historical_engagements: First Battle of El Alamein (July 1-27, 1942) - Defensive operations immediately upon arrival
Second Battle of El Alamein (October 23 - November 11, 1942) - Major defensive battle

source: Tessin, Georg - Verb채nde und Truppen der deutschen Wehrmacht und Waffen-SS, Band 07, pages 140-141 (regiment designations: 125, 382, 433, Artillery Regiment 220)

command.commander.previous_service.reason: Primary Nafziger PDF unreadable. Backfill data provides name and appointment date but not previous service record.
command.commander.previous_service.mitigation: Research German personnel files or divisional histories for Lungershausen's career

command.chief_of_staff.name.reason: No primary sources available provide Chief of Staff identity for newly arrived division in Q3 1942
command.chief_of_staff.name.mitigation: Consult German divisional staff records or war diaries if available

subordinate_unit_commanders.reason: Regimental and battalion commander names not documented in available sources for Q3 1942 timeframe. Division newly arrived, command structure not yet documented in accessible sources.
sources_checked: Tessin Vol 7 (unit numbers only, not commanders)
subordinate_unit_commanders.mitigation: Research Tessin volumes comprehensively, German regimental histories, or personnel records

exact_equipment_counts.reason: Primary Nafziger PDF unreadable. No detailed TO&E data available for Q3 1942 period. Estimates based on generic German light division establishment with reduced motorization noted in historical records.
sources_checked: 90. leichte Division TO&E as comparison template
exact_equipment_counts.estimate_method: Standard German light division TO&E 1942 reduced by 30% for vehicles to reflect 'limited motorization' documented in historical records. Infantry weapons estimated from personnel count (9,200) using standard rifle company TO&E ratios. Artillery estimated from single artillery regiment (vs. three for 90. leichte) with two battalions of 105mm and one battery of 150mm guns.

combat_performance_Q3.reason: Division arrived August 1942 and immediately engaged at First Battle of El Alamein (July 1-27 predates arrival, so only late July engagement if any). Specific performance records for August-September 1942 not available in accessible sources.
sources_checked: Historical context from web searches (arrival date August 1942)
combat_performance_Q3.mitigation: Research First and Second El Alamein battle reports, German after-action reports, Commonwealth intelligence assessments
